content: The following lists events that happened during **1985 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [C.V. Devan Nair](/wiki/Devan_Nair) (until 28 March), [Wee Chong Jin](/wiki/Wee_Chong_Jin) (Acting) (28 to 29 March), [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng) (Acting) (29 March to 2 September), [Wee Kim Wee](/wiki/Wee_Kim_Wee) (starting 2 September) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - January - [Funan Centre](/wiki/Funan_DigitaLife_Mall) opens to the public. It evolved to Funan The IT Mall, and finally Funan DigitaLife Mall, closing its doors on 30 June 2016. ### February - 1 February – The Small Claims Tribunal is established as part of the Subordinate Courts (present day [State Courts of Singapore](/wiki/State_Courts_of_Singapore)), which mainly deals with [small claims](/wiki/Small_claims). ### March - 28 March – Singapore's third [President](/wiki/President_of_the_Republic_of_Singapore) [Devan Nair](/wiki/Devan_Nair) resigns. [Chief Justice](/wiki/Chief_Justice_of_Singapore) [Wee Chong Jin](/wiki/Wee_Chong_Jin) and later [Speaker of Parliament](/wiki/Speaker_of_the_Parliament_of_Singapore) [Yeoh Ghim Seng](/wiki/Yeoh_Ghim_Seng) temporarily serve as acting president during that time. ### April - 2 April – The [NTUC Pasir Ris Resort](/wiki/NTUC_Downtown_East) starts construction. When completed, the resort will have a wide array of recreational activities, supporting up to 1,400 people at any time. The resort is officially opened in 1988. - 15 April – The Feedback Unit is formed to allow people to feedback their concerns to the Government. It has since been replaced by [REACH](/wiki/REACH_(Singapore)) in 2006. ### May - 16 May – The first case of [HIV](/wiki/HIV) is diagnosed at the Communicable Diseases Centre (present day [National Centre for Infectious Diseases](/wiki/National_Centre_for_Infectious_Diseases)). The patient is subsequently warded at the CDC. - 23 May - An 18 year old student, [Winnifred Teo Suan Lie](/wiki/Winnifred_Teo_Suan_Lie) became a victim of rape and murder. Her naked body was discovered in bushes by police along Old Holland Road. It remains an unsolved case. ### June - 24 June – The [National University Hospital](/wiki/National_University_Hospital) is opened to the public, the first government-owned hospital to be privately run. ### August - 30 August – [Wee Kim Wee](/wiki/Wee_Kim_Wee) becomes the fourth [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore). He takes office on 2 September. ### December - 2 December – The [Second Series Coins](/wiki/Singapore_dollar#Coins) are launched, with the 5-cent, 10-cent, 20-cent and 50-cent coins the first to be issued. ### Date unknown - Singapore slips into its first recession during that time, as well as the [Pan Electric crisis](/wiki/Pan-Electric_Industries). (Early 1985) - [Shop N Save](/wiki/Cold_Storage_(supermarket)#Shop_N_Save) starts operations as a supermarket. - [Sheng Siong](/wiki/Sheng_Siong) starts operations as a supermarket, taking over from the Savewell supermarket chain, which closed down the following year due to financial problems. ## Births - 22 January – [Yan Xu](/wiki/Yan_Xu_(table_tennis)), table tennis player. - 9 April – [Romeo Tan](/wiki/Romeo_Tan), actor. - 16 June – [Andie Chen](/wiki/Andie_Chen), actor. ## Deaths - 15 February – [Chen Chong Swee](/wiki/Chen_Chong_Swee), Artist (b. 1910). - 2 March – [Runme Shaw](/wiki/Runme_Shaw), Founder of [Shaw Organisation](/wiki/Shaw_Organisation) and philanthropist (b. 1901). - 21 June – Ng Aik Huan, prominent businessman, Hokkien community leader and member of the [Nanyang University](/wiki/Nanyang_University) Council (b. 1908). - 26 August – S. T. Bani, former unionist and politician (b. 1934). - 15 December – [Chew Swee Kee](/wiki/Chew_Swee_Kee), former [Minister for Education](/wiki/Minister_for_Education_(Singapore)) (b. 1918). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1985 in Singapore
